intro: Wulffia rubens, commonly known as the red wulffia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers and hairy stems. Its leaves are ovate and often have a velvety texture. Wulffia rubens is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swamps.
